block.p: Jennifer Dena Saken, the daughter of Norma Y. Rasmussen of Wrightwood, Calif., and Joel Saken of Los Angeles, is to be married today to Gregory David Shufro, the son of Lydie Tartakowski Shufro and Edward G. Shufro, both of New York. Dana Saroken, a rabbinical student at the Jewish Theological Seminary in New York, is to perform the ceremony at the Sundeck, a chalet atop Ajax Mountain in Aspen, Colo.

The bride, 29, is the marketing and events manager in New York for the Jetform Corporation, a Canadian software company. She graduated from the University of Arizona. Her father is a fashion designer in Los Angeles. Her mother owns Pineview House, a bed and breakfast in Wrightwood.

Jennifer Dena Saken, the daughter of Norma Y. Rasmussen of Wrightwood, Calif., and Joel Saken of Los Angeles, is to be married today to Gregory David Shufro, the son of Lydie Tartakowski Shufro and Edward G. Shufro, both of New York. Dana Saroken, a rabbinical student at the Jewish Theological Seminary in New York, is to perform the ceremony at the Sundeck, a chalet atop Ajax Mountain in Aspen, Colo.

The bride, 29, is the marketing and events manager in New York for the Jetform Corporation, a Canadian software company. She graduated from the University of Arizona. Her father is a fashion designer in Los Angeles. Her mother owns Pineview House, a bed and breakfast in Wrightwood.

The bridegroom, 31, is the counsel and director of business development at Capitalyst, a venture capital concern in Boston. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a law degree from Fordham. His father is a partner in Shufro, Rose & Company, an investment advisory firm in New York. The bridegroom's mother is a trustee of the W. F. Albright Institute of Archaeological Research.
